He introduced this as a three-stage process, which he likened to melting a block of ice, and refreezing it in a different shape. The three stages are Unfreeze, Change and Refreeze.
Lewin developed the change model as a way to illustrate how people react when facing changes in their lives
For Lewin, the process of change entails creating the perception that a change is needed, then moving toward the new, desired level of behavior and, finally, solidifying that new behavior as the norm. he introduced structural changes, tranformational changes He recognized framework for managing change in organizations. It was developed by psychologist Kurt Lewin in the 1950s and is still widely used today.

data.stimulus: Can you reflect on any change management model
